data.title: Famous People with Autism [180+ Athletes, Actors, Musicians & More!]
data.meta_description: This is the ultimate list of famous people with autism.
data.text:
There are many famous people with autism. They include athletes, actors, inventors, business leaders, authors and artists.

There are about 180 famous autistic people I found as part of our research on Ongig‚Äôs series on neurodiversity. I felt inspired to list all these amazing people in one place!

Disclaimers: This list includes famous people with Autism who have been diagnosed and those who have been reported or rumored to fall somewhere on the Autism spectrum. I do my best to list resources for any questionable ones and welcome feedback, additions and edits! I am not an expert on autism.

Celebrities with Autism

If you had to list the very top celebrities with autism, it‚Äôd likely be this list:

Woody Allen (rumored)

David Byrne (diagnosed)

Dan Aykroyd (diagnosed)

Charles Darwin (rumored)

Thomas Edison (rumored)

Albert Einstein (rumored)

Darryl Hannah (diagnosed)

Alfred Hitchcock (rumored)

Courtney Love (diagnosed)

Lionel Messi (rumored)

Sir Isaac Newton (rumored)

Steve Jobs (rumored)

Jerry Seinfeld (self-diagnosed)

But let‚Äôs break it down in more detail.

There are so many reported famous people with autism that I categorize them by their professional field (Actors, Athletes, Musicians, Leaders, etc.). I also added a section for celebrities with autistic children.

I do my best to provide sourcing wherever I could.

I hope you‚Äôre as inspired by these great humans as I am!

Is Sir Anthony Hopkins Autistic? According to Mercury News, he received a late-in-life diagnosis of Asperger‚Äôs.

Anthony Hopkins Autism Facts

In 2017, Anthony Hopkins was interviewed by the Daily Mail about his troubles with addiction and Asperger‚Äôs. Anthony Hopkins‚Äô autistic diagnosis, more specifically Asperger‚Äôs, was diagnosed late in life. He told the Daily Mail he was a loner and said:

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt go to parties, I don‚Äôt have many friends‚Ä¶But I do like people. I do like to get inside their heads.‚Äù

When asked if his Asperger‚Äôs helped him as an actor, he said:

‚ÄúI definitely look at people differently. I like to deconstruct, to pull a character apart, to work out what makes them tick and my view will not be the same as everyone else. I get offered a lot of controlling parts, maybe because that‚Äôs how people see me. And maybe I am very controlled because I‚Äôve had to be. I don‚Äôt question it, I just take the parts because I‚Äôm an actor and that‚Äôs what I do.‚Äù

Heather Kuzmich ‚Äì America‚Äôs Next Top Model Contestant

Paige Layle ‚Äì TikTok Personality

Paige Layle Talks Autism on TikTok

Paige Layle is an eyelash technician from Ontario who recently went viral on TikiTok after posting a 4-part series about being an autistic woman. Her TikTok account is filled with facts about autism and she talks about how it took a long time to get her diagnosis because she is a woman that doesn‚Äôt necessarily ‚Äúfit the mold‚Äù of being autistic. People Magazine reported that:

@paigelaylelearn more about autism! üôÇ i get many questions every day to make more vids about it, i will continue to show you guys! ##feature ##fup ##fyp ##featureme‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì paigelayle

‚Äúwill focus on conditions such as dyslexia, ADD, ADHD and autism as examples of diversity in the human condition rather than disorders that must be ‚Äúcured.‚Äù‚Äù

Big Brother Star, Ian has recently opened up about being autistic. Ian was diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) as a child. What is ASD? According to the CDC, ASD is a developmental disability that can cause significant social, communication, and behavioral challenges.

Ian said on Twitter:

Is Keir Gilchrist Autistic?

Keir Gilchrist plays teenager Sam Gardner in Netflix‚Äôs Atypical. Sam is autistic in the show, causing many fans to ask ‚Äúis Keir Gilchrist autistic?‚Äù

The answer is no:

Despite playing an autistic character, Gilchrist is not autistic. The actor did a great deal of research to get to the point where he could play an autistic person, including reading works by writer and speaker David Finch.

source: Newsweek, ‚ÄòAtypical‚Äô on Netflix: Is Sam Actor Keir Gilchrist Actually Autistic?, July 12, 2021

Lionel Messi is a worldwide soccer superstar, but there are rumors that he struggled with Autism early in life. According to WessexScene.com:

‚ÄúThere are unconfirmed reports that Messi was diagnosed with Asperger‚Äôs Syndrome (a pervasive developmental disorder on the autistic spectrum) at the age of 9.‚Äù

As a child, Messi kept to himself and was known in his village as ‚Äòel peque√±o mudito‚Äô (‚Äòthe little mute‚Äô). His extreme focus on his sport has many autism experts convinced he has Asperger‚Äôs or is somewhere on the autism spectrum.

Jerry Seinfeld Autism Controversy

As part of our research, we were amazed to find a high volume of people querying Google about whether comedian Jerry Seinfeld is autistic (e.g. 400 people per month Google the phrase ‚ÄúJerry Seinfeld Autism‚Äù.

The Seinfeld autism controversy began in an interview with Brian Williams of NBC News:

Here‚Äôs the full transcript:

Seinfeld:

‚ÄúI think, on a very drawn out scale, I think I‚Äôm on the spectrum.‚Äù

Brian Williams:

‚ÄúWhy, what are the markers if I was sitting here analyzing you‚Ä¶‚Äù

Seinfeld:

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre never paying attention to the right things.

Basic social engagement is really a struggle.

I‚Äôm very literal.‚Äù

Comments on the Youtube video included a mix of reactions:

‚ÄúI‚Äôm an autism specialist and this does not offend me. I Googled Jerry Seinfeld Asperger‚Äôs for a reason‚Äìbecause of how he struck me on the Garry Shandling documentary.‚Äù ‚Äî Keldra Alpine

‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt really look like autism. I could be mistaken but [Seinfeld] makes successful eye contact and he he can keep a conversation going. I have level 2 autism (by the new criteria, it‚Äôs moderate autism.). He doesn‚Äôt really seem autistic because 1. you need to have repetitive actions, or things, whatever 2. you need to have communication issues and 3. I can‚Äôt remember.‚Äù ‚Äî William Childs

‚ÄúI am not in a position to say that he‚Äôs been misdiagnosed, but I cannot in any envision someone with ASD being a successful stand-up comedian. I could see an autistic person being comical for 10-15 minutes in front of a small group of people, but I cannot see them doing comedy night after night as a career. When I was diagnosed (in 1997, with Asperger‚Äôs, which has since merged with other forms of autism to become ASD), my understanding was that the prototype for Asperger‚Äôs were people like Isaac Newton and Immanuel Kant (both of whom neither married or had children and (in the case of Newton) quite possibly/likely died a virgin ‚Äì I guess you could say he had more interest in discovering g-forces than the g-spot). Both of these men were obsessed with discovering knowledge and (what they believed to be) eternal laws about the universe and had little interest in sociparl relations. Try as I may, I do not see any aspect of either Newton or Kant in Jerry.‚Äù ‚Äî Devin Elgert

Seinfeld later walked back his comments on having Autism:

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have autism,‚Äù Seinfeld told ‚ÄúAccess Hollywood.‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not on the spectrum.‚Äù

Famous Leaders with Autism

Political leaders are not always open about their struggles with neurodiversity. But Joshua Collins who is running for a congressional seat in Washington state is open about being autistic. The Mighty reported:

‚ÄúCollins was originally running in the election as a Democrat but is now the pioneer of the left-leaning coalition Essential Workers‚Äô Party. If he wins the election, Collins would be the first known openly autistic Congressmember in United States‚Äô history.‚Äù

Collins also has 2 members on his campaign team who are autistic.

Diagnosed with Autism

Joshua Collins ‚Äì Congressional candidate

Conner Cummings ‚Äì Autism Activist

Conner Cummings didn‚Äôt speak until he was 7 years old and now he receives standing ovations. Honored with numerous awards including Advocate of the year by Autism Society of America. He changed a law with his mother in 2015 (named ‚ÄúConner‚Äôs Law‚Äù after him).

He has been instrumental in assisting numerous bills to pass within the past 7 years and was appointed to the Virginia Disability Commission in 2020. Conner is also an Ambassador to Zoom Autism Magazine where everyone who works on the magazine is autistic (except his mother).

He said because of his ability to remove emotion from a situation, he is able to see a clear series of targets, tasks and creative solutions whenever an issue arises. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm actually making history tonight as the first person with Asperger‚Äôs to host SNL, or, at least the first to admit it, so I won‚Äôt make a lot of eye contact with the cast tonight. But don‚Äôt worry, I‚Äôm pretty good at running human in emulation mode.‚Äù

Satoshi Tajiri Autism and His Obsessions

Is the Creator of Pok√©mon autistic? Yes, and Satoshi Tajiri credits his autism for his success. Having obsessions like bug collecting and video games during his youth. The Art of Autism reported that:

‚ÄúThe latter captured so much of his time and attention that he actually cut classes and wound up flunking high school. His parents were concerned; they actually didn‚Äôt understand his obsession with games and thought he was a delinquent throwing his life away.‚Äù

Despite his parents‚Äô concerns, Tajiri channeled these hobbies and created a video game that changed the world! Santoshi Tajiri went on record saying:

‚Äúthat he wanted the games to give children the same joy as he had during his bug collecting.‚Äù

A quote from the WikiLeaks founder from the UK Independent:
